private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E is largest in my subset).
I represent the worker responsible for the five smallest disks.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration matches the global goal while only moving disks A through E and obeying Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J.
I represent the worker responsible for the middle five disks.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration matches the global goal while only moving disks F through J and obeying Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks: K, L, M, N, O.
I represent the worker responsible for the five largest disks.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration matches the global goal while only moving disks K through O and obeying Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I integrate the partial move sequences from the three agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward.
I must ensure agent move permissions remain enforced and that the combined plan respects Tower of Hanoi rules.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a validated global plan and a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that encode the final plan and the Tower of Hanoi instance with the given constraints.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 15 disks labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg contains disks (top to bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg (top to bottom) C, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg (top to bottom) A, E; right peg (top to bottom) B, D.

Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, a move consists of moving the top disk of a peg to the top of another peg, and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent move permissions are restricted: agent_1 may only move disks A-E, agent_2 may only move disks F-J, agent_3 may only move disks K-O.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, using the exact text format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each move. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and not attempt to move disks outside your allowed set. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on correctness and legality of your moves and on how they interleave with other agents where needed.
local_plan.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A smallest through O largest. Initial left peg contains A through O top to bottom. Goal: left peg top to bottom C, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top to bottom A, E; right peg top to bottom B, D. You may only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Provide a safe ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume other agents will move disks you are not allowed to move. Ensure each move is legal given current visible state and the moves you produce.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You may only move disks F, G, H, I, J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, using the exact text format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each move. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and not attempt to move disks outside your allowed set. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on correctness and legality of your moves and on how they interleave with other agents where needed.
local_plan.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A smallest through O largest. Initial left peg contains A through O top to bottom. Goal: left peg top to bottom C, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top to bottom A, E; right peg top to bottom B, D. You may only move disks F, G, H, I, J. Provide a safe ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume other agents will move disks you are not allowed to move. Ensure each move is legal given current visible state and the moves you produce.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You may only move disks K, L, M, N, O. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, using the exact text format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each move. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and not attempt to move disks outside your allowed set. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on correctness and legality of your moves and on how they interleave with other agents where needed.
local_plan.prompt: You are agent_3. Public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A smallest through O largest. Initial left peg contains A through O top to bottom. Goal: left peg top to bottom C, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top to bottom A, E; right peg top to bottom B, D. You may only move disks K, L, M, N, O. Provide a safe ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume other agents will move disks you are not allowed to move. Ensure each move is legal given current visible state and the moves you produce.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the partial move sequences from agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3. Verify legality of the combined move sequence with respect to Tower of Hanoi rules and agent move permissions. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that fully encode the validated instance and the integrated plan, formatted and compatible with the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Keep actions of each agent distinct in the encoding and ensure that the PDDL encodes agent move permission constraints. If any ambiguity or illegality is found in the agents' plans, resolve it minimally while preserving as much of their sequences as possible and document the resolution as comments in the PDDL problem section.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive three ordered lists of primitive moves from agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3. Your job is to validate and integrate them to achieve the global goal: left peg top to bottom C, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top to bottom A, E; right peg top to bottom B, D. Ensure Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions are enforced. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward that encode the instance, permissions, and the integrated plan. Enclose the domain with <domain></domain> and the problem with <problem></problem>. Also output the final ordered list of primitive moves in the same textual format used by the agents as an appended comment in the PDDL problem section.
